entry.title: Injection
entry.summary: Overview of the selection process for brine injection project
entry.content:
The brine injection problem was selected as the basis for a "quick and dirty" project where an adaptiv method could be applied. The project was to be confined to approximatly 3 month, this means that it is nessecary to significantly deliminate the purpose and make wide use of "hand held" solutions in order to quickly try out ideas.

Process description

Brine is pumped in to a wide range of meat before packaging in order to mature, tenderize and enhance flavour. The brine consists of water and a mixture of salts, nitrate and in some cases sugar or various types of flavoring.

Initial experiement

An inital experiment was conducted in order to investigate the effect of the two primary proces parameters; brine pressure and injection speed, as well as determine the possibilities for visually measuring the gain using 3D sensing.

State-of-the-art

Brine injection:

New needles

Machines:

Schröder (DE): Automated adjustment of brine pressure based on weight before and after injection.

IMAX 420

Günther (DE) Individual needle damage and flow detection.

PI 750 DUO

FOMACO (DK) Inline Weight Controller (IWC) constantly monitors the injection quantity and corrects the settings in case of irregularities.

M3

Metalbud Nowicki (PL)

GAROS (SE)

Marel (IS)

Project directions

Basic "chip-tuning" focused on exsisting medium-low tier machines * Automation of procesparameters using feedback from weighing before and after injection

  • Advanced "chip-tuning" focused on exsisting top tier machines
    • Automatic switching between recipes based on detection of meat type
    • Local adjustment of brine based on

  • Robot cell solution

    • Same as Advanced "chip-tuning"
    • High flexibility and
    • Automatic cleaning

  • Robot cell for experimentation, specifically determining local absorbtion properties

    • Local injection of brine followed by weighing in order to determine local gain

  • Misc. additions
    • Monitoring of flow and detection of blocked needles
    • Avoiding brine injection into non-muscle areas e.g. fat and air pockets. Requires CT scanning or similar.

Research possibilities

  • Controlling procesparameters %* Neural network nonlinear predictive control popular paper

  • Estimating volume/weight from 2D or 3D images
